Line 5: Line 5:      
'''Love''' has several different meanings in every language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something one would die for ([[patriotism]], pairbonding). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. Probably due to its psychological relevance, love is one of the most common themes in art.
 
'''Love''' has several different meanings in every language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something one would die for ([[patriotism]], pairbonding). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. Probably due to its psychological relevance, love is one of the most common themes in art.
−
Love might best be defined as acting intentionally, in sympathethic response to others, to promote overall well-being ([[Thomas Jay Oord]]).
+
Love might best be defined as acting intentionally, in sympathethic response to others (including God), to promote overall well-being ([[Thomas Jay Oord]]).
     
Love is inherent in all human cultures. It is precisely these cultural differences that make any universal definition of love difficult, but not impossible, to establish. See the [[Sapir-Whorf hypothesis]].
 
Love is inherent in all human cultures. It is precisely these cultural differences that make any universal definition of love difficult, but not impossible, to establish. See the [[Sapir-Whorf hypothesis]].
